fields.description:
When there are multiple workflows in Jira with similar names (ie: dev workflow, copy of dev workflow, dev workflow 1.0, etc) it uses post functions from these workflows.  The problem feels similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29393 and I think they may actually be the same issue.  

The errors in the logs refer to class not found from a missing plugin, even though no functions from the plugin are present in the workflow.  Copies or similarly named inactive workflows do contain references to the classes that are not available, though and this seems to cause the class not found errors.  When I deleted the similarly names workflows, the errors stopped.
fields.summary: Jira doesn't handle workflows with similar names very well

fields.description:
When issue is created by standard mail handler ("Create a new issue or add a comment..."), trailing part of summary text is replaced by strange characters.
It only happens for issues written in russian. 

Example:
I send mail with subject:
"Длинное название с большим количеством символов. Будет ли нормально отображаться?"
Created issue has summary:
"Длинное название с большим количеством с=?koi8-r?B?yc3Xz8zP1y4g4tXExdQgzMkgzs/SzcHM2M7PIM/Uz8LSwdbB1NjT0T8=?="

If subject text is short enough (~40), summary is correct.
fields.summary: Part of summary text is replaced by strange symbols for auto-created issues by mail handler
Add ability to change keyboard shortcuts

fields.description: The edit control for minimize and refresh on dashboard's gadget is not displayed correctly in Chrome v22. However, it will be back to its original position if it is being zoomed in or out.
fields.summary: Edit controls on dashboard not displaying correctly

fields.description: ./bin/permgen.sh explicitly sets JAVA_HOME, which overrides any JAVA_HOME set by environment variables. this contradicts documentation (on how to set JAVA_HOME for JIRA) and is probably a bug in the script.
fields.summary: permgen.sh Overrides JAVA_HOME

fields.description:
Once the a customfield with the user / group picker or multi user / group picker added in the browse project permission, this project is visible for all login user.

Here are the steps to reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a customfield with the user / group picker or multi user / group picker. 
2. Create a new empty permission scheme (no groups or users should have permission), then add the customfield in the browse project permission. 
3. Create a new project with the permission scheme. 
4. Login with any user only belong to the group jira-users. The user is able to browse the project even he is not added as a value of the customfield.
fields.summary: User/Group picker provokes a permission violation when added to the Browse project permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29945].
  {panel}

There is no documentation available at the moment to describe the option "Migrating users from one directory to another". I have added a KB article her e: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Migrating+users+from+one+directory+to+another for now to cover this.

Please create a document page for JIRA 5.0 to cover this feature.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Documentation required for the option "Migrating users from one directory to another"

fields.description:
It should be possible for us to clone a workflow transition, via workflow designer. The steps taken should be:
- Create a transition connecting 2 statuses
- Select the Clone Transition option, and select an existing workflow transition that contains several transition validators

After creating the cloned transition, we may try to view the cloned transition validator, and we will notice that the the existing configured validators are missing:
!missingvalidator.png!

Only the validators are not copied over after cloning a workflow transition. The conditions and post functions are copied as expected
fields.summary: 'Clone Transition' feature does not copy the cloned transition validators

Hello,
I tried to set up Constellio and I encountered a problem so I wanted to seek some help in the user mailing list. After signing up I tried to post something but it just doesn't show up on the frontpage. I tried three times, one of those with another account but everytime without any success. There was no error message, it just did not appear on the frontpage.

Greetings
Daniela

fields.summary: Upon Update of JIRA's UPM, Greenhopper's Agile Menu Is Broken
SQL Logger is failing to log SQL string for Statements with no bind variables

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

If you have an issue in one project, then try to move it, and the original assignee is not valid in the new project, then you will be prompted to specify a new assignee.

In previous versions the default value there would be "Automatic", however it seems that in 5.1.5, the value there is "-1".

This affects only a single issue move, bulk issue move seems unaffected.

h3. Workaround

For a single issue, start typing "Automatic" and it will be able to use the auto-assign.

You can also get around this by using a bulk change.
fields.summary: When moving an issue between projects where the assignee is not valid in destination, assignee defaults to "-1"

fields.description:
It is possible for us to create a custom release notes template, as according to the following documentation:
- [Creating a Custom Release Notes Template Containing Release Comments|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Creating+a+Custom+Release+Notes+Template+Containing+Release+Comments]

And from the documentation, it is possible for us to enable velocity auto reload, so that the changes that we made to the velocity template will be picked up without restarting JIRA:
{quote}
In a development instance, you can play with picking up velocity file changes without a restart.

From <jira-install>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/velocity.properties:
# Change class.resource.loader.cache from true to false
# Uncomment (remove the # sign from) #velocimacro.library.autoreload=true
{quote}

However, the autoreload property is not working for JIRA 5.1.x (tested on JIRA 5.1.2 and 5.1.5). Hence if there any changes made to the Velocity template file, we will have to restart JIRA although the option has already been enabled. 

The behavior is not reproducible in JIRA 5.0.5.

*Workaround*: Use Tomcat 7 and this should work!
fields.summary: "autoreload" Velocity property is not working for JIRA 5.1.x

When JIRA makes outbound requests, some configs require that it go through an outbound proxy. It's not working over NTLM.

Note that this is totally unrelated to NTLM authentication for logins.

See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-2326 for the equivalent confluence issue.

See https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/88723/atlassian-marketplace-server-is-not-reachable.
fields.summary: Add NTLM authentication through outbound proxy servers - for plugin repository

h4. Workaround
h5. In JIRA:
# Go to Administration > System > General Configuration > Edit Configuration
# Disable *Use gzip compression* > Update

h5. In user's or client's end
Flush the browser cache. Otherwise the workaround won't work. To verify this, you can simply try it using Chrome's [incognito mode|http://support.google.com/chrome/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=95464]

|| Confluence || Confluence GZIP || JIRA || JIRA GZIP || FishEye || GreenHopper || FishEye Gadget in Confluence || GreenHopper Gadget in Confluence ||

h5. Test notes
- Confluence <-> JIRA = AppLink
- JIRA <-> FishEye = AppLink
- Each Atlassian app is located in different machine/box
- All mentioned gadgets can be added in JIRA without any problem
- Problem only occured when adding the gadget in Confluence, it can't be saved in the macro browser. For gadgets that has been added in Confluence, it'll still appear without any problem.
- When GZIP is disabled in JIRA. Problem will not occur. This requires flushing browser cache. Force refresh through Shift+ReloadButton doesn't work for some reason. You need to flush it manually. Or simply try with Chrome [Incognito mode|http://support.google.com/chrome/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=95464] to see the result. re: JRA-28930
- When GZIP is enabled in JIRA. Problem will occur straight away without having to flush browser cache. re: JRA-28930
- For some reason the {{java.io.EOFException}} stacktrace will only be thrown once.

  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

Could you please investigate building into jira the possibility of customizing the options available at the header of each ticket.

Currently the options available are:

* Assign
* Assign to me
* Comment
* More actions

One of options our company's staff users over and over is the "log work" from "More actions".

Could you please implement functionality that would facilitate having that option in the base (top level) header for each ticket.
fields.summary: new feature: move "log work" from "more action" to ticket header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29901].
  {panel}

Here is the procedure to reproduce the issue:

# Set up fresh jira
# Create a user A in the LDAP server which got no membership settings. (single user without group)
# Set up delegated ldap - with only the option "copy User on Login" and set the default group member to "jira-users".
# Login with the user A, so that it can be added in the group "jira-users".
# Logout the user A.
# Edit the delegated user directory and check the option "Synchronise Group Memberships".
# Login with the user A again, we found that it is impossible to login. 

Regarding to the login file, the user had been removed from the user group when login, here is an example of the message: 
{noformat}
2012-09-27 18:39:35,327 http-6512-10 INFO anonymous 1119x482x1 1mknmyc 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [atlassian.crowd.directory.DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory] Deleted user "user"'s imported membership of remote group "jira-users" to directory "Delegated Authentication Directory".
2012-09-27 18:39:35,329 http-6512-10 INFO anonymous 1119x482x1 1mknmyc 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [atlassian.crowd.directory.DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory] Deleted user "user"'s imported membership of remote group "jira-developers" to directory "Delegated Authentication Directory".
Sep 27, 2012 6:39:35 PM com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent filterFormParameters
{noformat}
And we can observe the same in the user list.

So far we have been able to reproduce the bug only with OpenLDAP and Generic Directory Server.

The workaround for now would be to add the group memberships again after checking the "Synchronise Group Memberships" option.
fields.summary: Switching to "Synchronise Group Memberships" option in the delegated user directory should push changes back to remote directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29899].
  {panel}

h3. Problem:
The 'Resolution' field can not retain original value during Bulk Close issue, when performing the bulk transitions from issue navigator. This is only happen when the 'close issue' transition is using the same screen with 'Resolve issue' transition, which screen contains 'Resolution' filed.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Use the same screen for 'close issue'(in Resolved status) and 'Resolve issue' transition, make sure the screen contain 'Resolution' value.
# Search for 3 issue in one project which have different 'Assingee', 'Reporter' and 'Resolution', but same status 'Resolved'. As showing below:
!Capture.JPG|thumbnail!
# Bulk Transition this 3 issues, choose 'close issue', click on next, it will show:
!Capture2.JPG|thumbnail!

Which will force to change the resolution, unlike the 'Change Assignee' can uncheck and keep the same Assignee, even the 3 tickets are having the different 'Assignee'. In this case, if I change the resolution in this step, all the issues will be changed with same Resolution, as shown below:
!Capture3.JPG|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Before doing the bulk edit, remove the *Resolution* field from the Screen. Alternatively, create a draft of the workflow, make the *Close* transition use a different screen, and publish the draft. Only then try to bulk transition the issues.
fields.summary: The 'Resolution' field can not retain original value during Bulk Close issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29892].
  {panel}

When connecting JIRA to a Crowd server, we will auto-synchronise the user and her group memberships if the user was previously unknown.
On the other hand if the user was already known we don't update the group memberships on login, we just wait until next synchronise to update this.

The main reason this is a problem is that the user may have been added to groups "on the fly" during authorisation with the Crowd server.

See JRA-26882 for a discussion.
fields.summary: JIRA should synchronise group memberships for a user on each login

fields.description:
When typing in Korean in any autocomplete friendly field, suggestions do not popup (autocomplete does not work) unless user enters backspace, then a space (2 keys).  

Steps to reproduce:
* Created a new user: 재영 (when typing on an English keyboard with Korean input - type "wodud")
* Created a new issue, and in the reporter field typed: 재 ("wo")
* When user types a space then a backspace, autocomplete comes up

Copy, paste doesn't seem to have any issues. When typing users shouldn't have to enter two extra keys as autocomplete suggestions should come up on its own.
fields.summary: Autocompletion not working in Korean

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29887].
  {panel}

Configure JIRA's global permissions as such:

JIRA System Administrators = system-administrators
JIRA Administrators = system-administrators
JIRA Users = <EMPTY>
Browse Users = system-administrators
Create Shared Objects = system-administrators
Manage Group Filter Subscriptions = system-administrators
Bulk Change = system-administrators

Reindex JIRA so that it properly sets all permissions.  Now try to create a new dashboard or saved filter.  Now notice that it asks you to log in, even though you are already logged in.  Try again and you'll get challenged again.
fields.summary: Empty 'JIRA Users' global permissions blocks some JIRA operations

I'm not sure if inside the "Create Ticket" interface is the best place, but there should be an easier place to have the "Create Component" interface.
Right now its buried in the project administration screens, and its only accessible by certain permission scopes. 

In our context, we have lead developers who take on some of the PM tasks that could involve creating Components, but we don't need them to have full access to everything else a Project Administrator does. 

Thanks!

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29882].
  {panel}

Hello team,

This is an idea that came on my mind: what if we create a specific log file which tracks the System Information for each restart? It could be a file called {{atlassian-jira-sysinfo.log}}. 
Sometimes you want to retrieve this information, but it's hard to track if you have tons of JIRA logs and need to search for the last restart. This could be also very useful in case of an instance being down and System Information is not available through JIRA UI.

Please let me know if this is possible to implement.
Thanks!
fields.summary: Create JIRA System Information log

fields.description:
This is issue is related to [JRA-24558|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24558] which has been fixed and closed, but seems in JIRA 4.4.5, user who have a upper-case username are not able to search for their own issues.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Configure a LDAP connector
# Inside the LDAP directory, Create a user with username "administrator"
# Login with username "administrator" and create a ticket A
# Search issues reported by 'CurrentUser()', you will find ticket A
# Inside the LDAP directory, create a username "ADMIN"
# Login with username "ADMIN" and create a ticket B
# Search issues reported by 'CurrentUser()', you will NOT be able to find ticket B.

Basically, when you search 'Reporter = CurrentUser()' when your username is upper-case, you will not be able to search for your own issue has been created.
fields.summary: JIRA using Upper case username from LDAP cannot see own issues

There's a new feature with User Directories which has not been updated in the documentation: *Migrate users from one directory to another*

The feature was available for user to move users  from internal directory to *internal directory with LDAP authentication only* and *vice versa* since JIRA 5.0.3

I hope it helps.

Here is an example, consider that I got a user who gant the browse project and close issue permission, alos, he is including in the security level of the issue to gant basic access to the issue.

In the workflow of the project, the close issue transition will perform a post function to set the resolution to Fixed in the first place, which needs the edit issue permission. 

When the user is tried to close the issue, he is able to trigger the transition but none of the post function will be triggered and he do not have the permission. But there is not error or warning message for this permission violation.

fields.description:
In case the welcome plugin is disable on JIRA, it is impossible to send the share notification to any user to either share the issue or the filter. 

The following javascript error message will appear once when performing the share operation: 
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Object Your browser supports SVG.
You are running Raphaël 1.5.2 has no method 'spinner' batch.js:3204
{code} 

The root cause of the issue is that the share plugin is currently using one of the Raphael method present in the welcome plugin. 

As a workaround solution, please enable the welcome plugin. If you still want to disable the plugin, please disable all modifiable module except the module *"What's New Web Resources(whats-new-resources)"*.
fields.summary: Issue/filter share is not working if the welcome plugin is disabled
Adding protocol (ldap://) to hostname in user directory leads to error

fields.description:

As an admin of a Webhooks client I would like JIRA to queue messages to clients in the event that the client cannot be reached

fields.description:
While creating a custom notification type and the associated listener, it was discovered that the AbstractNotificationType.getRecipients() method's passed in IssueEvent.getIssue().getProjectObject() is null. 

The workaround is to of course get a new Issue instance from the IssueManager using the IssueEvent.getIssue().getId() and then get the Project.
fields.summary: Notification Type Issue Listener IssueEvent Issue Object Project field not set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29849].
  {panel}

If you use any saved search that uses more than 3 ORDER BY criteria, the "JIRA filter results" gadget will ignore everything beyond the first 3 inputs.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a basic search using 4 search criteria (ex: due date, fixVersion, priority, severity)
2) Add a Filter Results Gadget to Dashboard
3) Compare ordering results between the Issue Navigator and the Dashboard gadget
4) Observe the dashboard gadget appears to not work for more than 3 ordering criteria
fields.summary: Filter Results Gadget does not respect more than 3 ORDER BY inputs

fields.description:
Custom field type 'Multi User Picker' will affect the Browser Project Permission, which users does not have the browser project permission(does not belong to any groups/project role related) will be able to view the project when add the custom filed into the 'browser project'.

To reproduce the problem by using the following steps:
# Create a custom field by using the 'Multi User Picker' for all issue types and for project 'testing':
!st1.JPG|thumbnail!
# Add the custom field to the 'Browse Projects' permission in project 'testing'. 
!st2.JPG|thumbnail!
# Create TWO users who does not belong to the browse projects permission users, in this testing case, they must not belong to 'Project Role (Administrators)', let's say 'amanda' and 'user'
!st3.JPG|thumbnail!
# Create a issue 'mytest' and add user 'user' in the custom field.
# Log in as 'amanda'. you will be able to view the project 'testing', but not able to view any issues in this project.
# Log in as 'user', you will be able to view the project 'testing' and the issue 'mytest'
# Delete the custom field from browse projects, both 'amanda' and 'user' will not be able to view the project 'testing' as expected.
fields.summary: User Picker field affecting the Browser Project permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Currently, the *Activity Stream* in *JIRA* only supports the following:
# Project
# JIRA Issue Key
# Update Date
# Username
# Activity
# Issue Type

!activity_stream_filter.JPG!

It will be better if there is a function whereby you are able to use custom JQL to filter out the *Activity Stream*.
fields.summary: Filtering Activity Stream using custom JQL

fields.description:
When adding the query parameters sorter/field=fixversions and sorter/order=desc I saw an interesting behavior where the fixversions were not quite sorted.

I have the following versions defined (I know the naming is a little weird):

componentX-1.5
componentX-1.4.3
componentX-1.4.2
componentX-1.4.1
componentX-1.4

When I look up JIRAs adding the query parameters sorter/field=fixversions and sorter/order=desc I saw an interesting behavior where the fixversions were not quite sorted. The order came back according to what I observed was the creation date. So in the Administration view I changed the order to put 1.5 above the 1.4.x versions, and then the sort behaved as expected.

I wouldn't expect it to use the ordering from that admin page, however, I would expect it to just sort lexicographically.
fields.summary: fixversions sorted by some internal identifier instead of display

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29823].
  {panel}

We have a need to see how long a scoop of issues have been in different states, f.ex.:

A scope of 100 issues have been in Created: 35m (Average) Hi:4h Lo:2m
A scope of 100 issues have been in Open: 65h (Average) Hi:71h Lo:14m
A scope of 100 issues have been in In Progress: 72h (Average) Hi:102h Lo:58m
A scope of 100 issues have been in Resolved: 40h (Average) Hi:112h Lo:16h

This scoop could include issues in one or more projects.

It should be possible to get a nice report printed of these figures.

( In the Jira suite plugin you get this info per issue, so you are half-way there already :) )
fields.summary: Lead time to enable reports containing time spent in status for a scoop of issues
